name: Katherine Mansfield
description: Pioneering modernist short story writer who transformed the literary landscape with her innovative narrative techniques and psychological depth
philosophy: I want to be all that I am capable of becoming. The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle.
contributions: Influenced Virginia Woolf and other modernist writers
Explored themes of alienation and identity
quotes: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can't build on it; it's only good for wallowing in.
Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
